definition: to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: When people's minds aren't yet emancipated and their thinking remains rigid, curious phenomena emerge.
sentences.chinese: 思想不解放，思想僵化，很多的怪現象就產生了。

sentences.english: A rigid outboard support system negates spindle deflection.
sentences.chinese: 僵化的舷外支持系統的否定主軸偏轉。

sentences.english: A seemingly inflexible adherence to specific, nonfunctional routines or rituals
sentences.chinese: 僵化地堅持某些特定，非功能性的生活習慣或儀式。

sentences.english: An American who has been short-changed would complain in the vernacular of being "stiffed".
sentences.chinese: 在美國土話中，常把被人愚弄形容成“僵化了。

sentences.english: Most humans are very ridged in their existence.
sentences.chinese: 大多數人類都是非常僵化的。

sentences.english: His government's bunker-like mentality has damaged communication with voters.
sentences.chinese: 他領導的政府僵化的態度已損壞與選民的溝通。

sentences.english: It is easy for the mind to ossify .
However, overdependence on tradition will result in rigidness and loss of enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 但過於依賴傳統會導致教會僵化，失去熱忱。

sentences.english: Paradoxically though, their thought might harden into ‘religions’ with rigid new dogmas?
sentences.chinese: 他們可能荒謬地認爲，宗教就是僵化的教條。

sentences.english: It shows that you do not buy into the myths and stereotypes about being single.
sentences.chinese: 這顯示，你再也不相信對單身的誤解和僵化看法了。

sentences.english: Too many share his rigid restrictionist convictions .
sentences.chinese: 許多人具有和他一樣的僵化的限制主義信念。

sentences.english: Caused the thesis teaching to fall into the ossified patternizing track.
sentences.chinese: 使作文教學陷入了僵化的模式化軌道。

sentences.english: That the issue is still being argued shows how rigid some people's thinking has become.
sentences.chinese: 現在對這樣的問題還要引起爭論，可見思想僵化。

sentences.english: He deplored the rigidity of her views.
Races which are petrified in dogma or demoralized by lucre are unfit to guide civilization.
sentences.chinese: 被教條僵化或被利慾腐蝕的民族不適宜領導文化。

definition: (idiom) to continue in the same old rut/diehard conservative attitudes
to come to the surface/to become apparent
stuck in the old ways (idiom); refusing to acknowledge new ideas/stagnating and conservative
